comments.body: I was hitting `cmake` failures building for linux, skipping that target for now.
I think we just landed a revert that should fix that

```
07:35 +25 ~7 -1: test/integration.shard/flutter_build_with_compilation_error_test.dart: flutter build linux shows dart compilation error in non-verbose [E]                                            
  Expected: contains 'A value of type \'String\' can\'t be assigned to a variable of type \'int\'.'
    Actual: 'cmake not found. Run \'flutter doctor\' for more information.\n'
              ''
  
  package:test_api                                                            expect
  test/integration.shard/flutter_build_with_compilation_error_test.dart 71:7  main.<fn>
  dart:async                                                                  runZoned
  test/src/common.dart 233:14                                                 testWithoutContext.<fn>
  test/src/common.dart 232:18                                                 testWithoutContext.<fn>
  test/src/common.dart 203:18                                                 test.<fn>
  test/src/common.dart 199:5                                                  test.<fn>
```
I guess `cmake` isn't in the PATH.  I'm going to re-skip linux and investigate this later.
